Articles.Content:
Trying to build a rover with 2 command seats for some Munar exploration, the design is currently undergoing tests on KSC. One major issue is:

Whenever a kerbal is leaving the seat, he is catapulted skywards a few meters. That will be hilarious on Mun or Minmus (once and only once). At first I thought it was because other parts were a bit too close to the in-seated kerbal but the same thing happens when I place a seat on top of a Mk I pod with no obstructing parts. Same catapultism every time. This did not happen to me in version 1.2 but appeared with v1.3.

Any insight to what is going on and how to work around (fix?) it?

Click the "useful mods" link in my sig below, install the patch to fix the seat eject.
install the "Drill Action Fix" patch too, as the drills are missing their deploy/retract/toggle actions and yes, it's a known bug that will be fixed in 1.3.1

Happy Landings!

Edited September 10, 2017 by Xyphos
Support type thread moved to the support type subforum.

This problem has been fixed and is currently available on the Patch Pre Release for testing.
https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/forum/77-ksp-pre-release/
